subject: Philosophy
title: Stoics vs. Epicureans
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stoics vs. Epicureans usable.

hook.text: Stoics said endure pain nobly. Epicureans said avoid pain entirely. Two schools, opposite strategies.

buildup.text: Epicurus taught that pleasure â€” especially calm, simple pleasure â€” is the highest good.

discovery.text: Stoics countered: virtue is the only true good. External pleasure is fragile and unreliable.

twist.text: In practice, both led to modest living. The Epicurean garden and Stoic porch agreed on more than they admitted.

climax.text: The rivalry lasted five centuries and shaped how the West thinks about happiness.

punchline.text: Seek pleasure or endure pain? That's still the question.

quiz.question: What did Epicureans consider the highest good?
